name: Baby phone game - Baby games
description:
“Baby Phone" for children is a cute toy phone for young children, who likes to play with mobile phone. This educational game will entertain the baby and also help them learn. Its like an own phone for the baby within the phone or tablet of the parents. This learning game provides a safe environment for the baby on the phone and helps in cognitive development. It gives them variety, repetition encourages self-confidence, improves logical thinking and more. It is a simple peekaboo game, that it is suitable for baby from 1 year old.

Features:
Listen to animal sounds and explore different farm animals. Baby can also call the animals and listen to them speaking back to them with funny sounds. And be ready for a surprise, when they call you back.

Learning numbers - use the numbers on the phone to dial different animals and beautiful characters and even the mother at times. Baby can also go to the phone directory and see who all are on the calling list :)

Nursery Rhymes - baby can also listen to various nursery rhymes on the phone by simply selecting the sound icon. Take some rest from the phone activity and simply enjoy the baby rhymes. We have selected the common ones, which the baby is taught in kindergarten as well.

Messaging (sms) - baby will also get a message from time to time, and they need to go and see who was send it to them. Beautiful colorful messages along with creative sounds will surprise them.

Skill development - from practicing fine motor skills to developing attention span and memory, this educational game will help in improving various skills for 2 and 3 year old baby.

Calling friends - we have developed the biggest phone directory for the baby with cute cartoon characters and have put equally great sounds and music. Kids who love surprise egg game, are in for a even bigger surprise.


If you have any feedback and suggestions on how we could further improve the design and interaction of our games, please visit our website www.iabuzz.com or leave us a message at kids@iabuzz.com
